verses.roman:
ataeva madhura rasa kahi tara nāma
svakīyā-parakīyā-bhāve dvi-vidha saṁsthāna

synonyms: ataeva—therefore; madhura—sweet; rasa—mellow; kahi—I say; tāra—of that; nāma—the name; svakīyā—svakīyā (own); parakīyā—and named parakīyā (another's); bhāve—in the moods; dvi-vidha—two types; saṁsthāna—positions.
translation: Therefore I call it madhura-rasa. It has two further divisions, namely wedded and unwedded love.
